channel.title: Infinitest for Eclipse Releases
channel.description: News feed for new Infinitest releases

item.title: Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.82 released - Merge back 5.1.79 changes
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.81 released - Built with Google Guava and Latest JUnit 4.8.2
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.80 released - First GPL version
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.78 released - Fixed issue with missing libraries in the plugin
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.77 released - Fixed issue with plugin manifest
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.76 released - Fixing installation verification issue
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.75 released - Added support for JUnit 4.8.1
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.74 released - Now running tests that inherit from classes that use a @RunWith annotation, like Scala Specs
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.73 released - Resolving many bugs related to missing classes and classpath issues
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.72 released - Infinitest core now uses Scala. Improved ScalaTest support coming soon.
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.71 released - Updated icons for licenses
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.70 released - Slight change to the license dialog
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.69 released - Licensing system improvements
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.68 released - Fixing null resources issue on Windows
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.67 released - Fixed lighthouse issue #7, related to projects with external jar dependencies
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.66 released - Failure viewer now closes when the user clicks somewhere else
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.65 released - Failure viewer now allows you to select stack trace elements using the mouse (in addition to the keyboard)
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.64 released - Fixed issue #13, regarding wrapping of long error messages in the failure viewer
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.63 released - Added assertion messages to test failure viewer
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.62 released - Added first version of new failure viewer, accessible as a quick fix on an error marker
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.61 released - Now supporting Hamcrest 1.2 by removing baked in verison of hamcrest 1.1
Infinitest for Eclipse 5.1.60 released - Infinitest console view now remains hidden, even when tests write to standard error
